name: NPR
text:
Jon Batiste's fingers playing the piano were animated for Pixar's new film.

"I was almost in tears, because you see your essence and you think: Wow, this is the first Black Pixar lead and we're putting jazz culture out there in this massive way."
https://t.co/zIs2tIBR9G

name: NPR
text:
Pope Francis: "I ask everyone — government leaders, businesses, international organizations — to foster cooperation and not competition, and to seek a solution for everyone: vaccines for all, especially for the most vulnerable and needy."
https://t.co/SO72oDVado

name: NPR
text: Scientists say a new variant of the coronavirus sweeping through the U.K. appears more transmissible and harder to control in terms of spread. https://t.co/IQBy7uB16f

name: NPR
text:
The new, more contagious coronavirus variant that has swept through the U.K. has been confirmed in a French citizen who recently traveled to London, officials said.
https://t.co/KSBzyZx9QT

name: NPR
text:
An Australian expeditioner has been medically evacuated from Antarctica, following a multinational operation by land, air and sea that spanned thousands of miles on the remote continent.
https://t.co/TKLXYxWNyg

name: NPR
text:
For 150 years, Cizhong Church in southwest China has been home to one of the country's rare Catholic communities. Their Christmas traditions are a colorful mixture of Buddhist and Christian practices.
https://t.co/GklMPaEJ9D

name: NPR
text: Food assistance programs across the U.S. have started connecting with local fishermen to stock up on seafood. The arrangement seems to be helping the fishermen, the economy and those in need of healthy food. https://t.co/l236zrzczy

name: NPR
text: George Clooney on the legacy he hopes to impart to his two kids: "If you only in your lifetime challenge people with power and defend people with less power, if you only do that in your life, you will be a success." https://t.co/IhN8VUSFcx

name: NPR
text: Tennessee's health commissioner: "If we have another surge after Christmas and New Year's like we did after Thanksgiving, it will completely break our hospitals." https://t.co/Mjr5tPKaUD

name: NPR
text: Antarctica is no longer the only continent free of the pandemic. https://t.co/UmZiljIhQW

name: NPR
text:
A new study of toddlers in Kenya suggests that having an older sister can have a powerful impact on a child's development — leading to improved early vocabulary and fine motor skills.
https://t.co/89tcYqgwUj

name: NPR
text:
The new Netflix documentary series "Rompan Todo" explores the socio-political history of rock music in Latin America from its genesis in the 1960s to the present.
https://t.co/bUIUeJUrlV

name: NPR
text:
Whether it was baking bread or finding new uses for old pantry staples (beans definitely had a moment), many people got cooking this year.
https://t.co/vwMFqcG34V

name: NPR
text:
The world's 5 centibillionaires aren't alone in getting richer as many people struggle to make ends meet. 

The 651 U.S. billionaires have seen their collective wealth rise by over $1 trillion roughly since the pandemic began, a report finds.

Read more: https://t.co/w5Sc0SVvMX https://t.co/0Tdpv3F9k7

name: NPR
text: The number of pet frauds in November was 5 times higher than it was in 2017 — and a total of $3.1 million in losses to these scams are projected for the year, a Better Business Bureau investigation finds.  @hereandnow https://t.co/qqtDj0AHJP

name: NPR
text: Restoring Notre Dame has led to new discoveries about the cathedral, such as that it’s not perfectly symmetrical. And workers have reached the cathedral’s vaults for the first time in hundreds of years. @hereandnow https://t.co/f6HXZhgKR8

name: NPR
text: Police in Nashville say a recording believed to be coming from the RV warned that a potential bomb would be detonated within 15 minutes and that those in the area should evacuate. https://t.co/ZxmcKUbuOl

name: NPR
text:
Atmospheric gases are trapped inside ice when it forms. The older the ice, the more scientists can learn how carbon dioxide levels have changed over Earth's history — shedding light on today's climate and beyond. 
https://t.co/T3SntVX6u4

name: NPR
text: 'Promising Young Woman' is a film drenched in sparkles both figurative and literal. It has a Candyland aesthetic and dares to dance to an actual Paris Hilton song. It feel like one type of film, but it takes a turn and becomes another. https://t.co/Qls4xgzaTR

name: NPR
text: RT @WPLN: There’s a lot we don’t know yet about the explosion that shattered windows, damaged buildings and rattled the city awake on Christmas morning, but here's what we do know: https://t.co/4WKZf8lQEk

name: NPR
text: "In the past year, we've come farther in understanding airborne transmission, or at least kind of beyond just the few experts who study it, than we have in decades," says Linsey Marr, a researcher at Virginia Tech. https://t.co/FK6LP8az3y

name: NPR
text: "The fact that Congress, according to recent polling, is held in lower regard than head lice, colonoscopies and the band Nickelback is some indication that the public doesn't hold Congress in high regard," said Rep. Derek Kilmer, D-Wash. https://t.co/GTJ6lAetsJ

name: NPR
text:
Barry Lopez, Acclaimed Author And Traveler Beyond Many Horizons, Dies At 75 

 Lopez was famous for chronicling his travels to remote places and the landscapes he found there. https://t.co/QsidA1X3y6

name: NPR
text: Decades before openly gay Americans were legally allowed to serve in the military, Joseph Patton, a gay man, served in silence. He was given an undesirable discharge for being friends with two men who told commanders they were lovers. https://t.co/eSh21t2HaF

name: NPR
text: RT @blanchardd: Lopez wrote often about the threat of climate change, and, in a sad irony, he was forced to leave his home in September because of the unusually powerful wildfires in Oregon. His wife told me, "The fire was a blow he never could recover from." https://t.co/oGLvrmmY4O
